title-part.text: DYEING LEATHER, FURS OR SOLID MACROMOLECULAR SUBSTANCES IN ANY FORM

note.note-paragraph: This subclass does not cover treatment of textiles by purely mechanical means, which is covered by subclasses D06B, D06C.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
D06P3/84 covered by D06P3/82
D06P3/85 covered by D06P3/82
D06P3/852 covered by D06P3/82
D06P3/86 covered by D06P3/82
D06P3/87 covered by D06P3/82
D06P3/872 covered by D06P3/82
D06P3/874 covered by D06P3/82
D06P5/24 - D06P5/28 covered by D06P5/003 and s.gr.

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: General processes of dyeing or printing textiles, or general processes of dyeing leather, furs, or solid macromolecular substances in any form, classified according to the dyes, pigments, or auxiliary substances employed

CPC-specific-text.text: Dyeing processes in which the dye is not specific (waste liquors)
Effecting dyeing to obtain luminescent or phosphorescent dyeings
Dye baths containing a dyeing agent in a special form such as for instance in melted or solid form, as a floating film or gel, spray or aerosol, or atomised dyes
Processing by repeated dyeing, e.g. in different baths
Dyeing and bleaching in one process
Determining dye recipes and dyeing parameters; Colour matching or monitoring
Dyeing and sizing in one process
Dyeing with phototropic dyes; Obtaining camouflage effects
Dyeing with a dye in volatilised form
Converting dyes in situ in a non-appropriate form by hydrolysis, saponification, reduction with split-off of a substituent
Dyeing with polymeric dyes involving building the polymeric dyes on the fibres
by using dyes with polymerisable groups, e.g. dye ---CH=CH2
by using reactive polyfunctional compounds, e.g. crosslinkers
Non-aqueous dyeing in an inorganic medium
Aqueous dyeing characterised by a short bath ratio

reference.text: D06P1/18, D06P1/38, D06P1/39, D06P1/41 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: the textile material containing one component
one or both of the components having fibre-reactive groups
using a stabilised diazo component, e.g. diazoamino, anti-diazotate or nitrosamine R-N=N-OK, diazosulfonate, hydrazinesulfonate, R-N=N-N-CN
using phthalocyanine dyes prepared in situ
using vat dyes in unreduced pigment state
Specific dyes not provided for in groups D06P1/228 - D06P1/28
or anthracene nucleus containing vat dyes

title-part.text: reactive group directly attached to heterocyclic group
reactive group not directly attached to heterocyclic group
using acid dyes without azo groups
using basic dyes without azo groups
using insoluble pigments or auxiliary substances, e.g. binders

CPC-specific-text.text: Use of auxiliary substances before, during or after dyeing or printing

title-part.text: using compositions containing natural macromolecular substances or derivatives thereof
using compositions containing synthetic macromolecular substances

CPC-specific-text.text: Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions involving only carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
Polymers of unsaturated compounds containing no COOH groups or functional derivatives thereof
Polymers of unsaturated hydrocarbons, e.g. polystyrene polyalkylene
Polymers of unsaturated carboxylic acids or functional derivatives thereof
Macromolecular compounds obtained otherwise than by reactions involving only unsaturated carbon-to-carbon bonds

title-part.text: Substances with reactive groups together with crosslinking agents
Condensation products or precondensation products prepared with aldehydes
together with other synthetic macromolecular substances

CPC-specific-text.text: containing CON=, OCON=, SO2N=, OSO2N= groups
addition products of amines and alkylene oxides or oxiranes
Addition products of hydroxyl groups-containing compounds with oxiranes
from aromatic alcohols or from phenols, naphthols
Condensation products of esters, acids, oils, oxyacids with oxiranes
Polymerisation products of glycols, e.g. Carbowax, Pluronics

title-part.text: using compositions containing low-molecular-weight organic compounds with sulfate, sulfonate,
using compositions containing low-molecular-weight organic compounds without sulfate or sulfonate groups

CPC-specific-text.text: Compounds containing nitro or nitroso groups
Compounds containing azide or oxime groups
Compounds containing isocyanate or isothiocyanate groups
Compounds containing hydrazine or azo groups
bound to a six-membered aromatic carbocyclic ring

title-part.text: Aliphatic, araliphatic or cycloaliphatic compounds containing amino groups
Nitrogen-containing carboxylic acids or their salts
Compounds containing carbonamide, thiocarbonamide or guanyl groups

CPC-specific-text.text: Compounds containing a guanyl group R-C-N=, e.g. (bi)guanadine, dicyandiamid amidines
Condensation products from carboxylic acids and hydroxyalkyl amine (Kritchewski bases)
Amides of di- or polyamines; Acylated polyamines
Compounds containing -CONCO-, e.g. phthalimides, hydantoine; Compounds containing RCONHSO2R (R=H or hydrocarbon)
Compounds containing aldehyde or ketone groups
Compounds containing ether or acetal groups
Compounds containing peroxide or ozonide groups
Compounds containing acid anhydride or acid halide groups
Compounds containing thioaldehyde or thiocetone groups
Compounds containing sulfide or disulfide groups
Compounds containing sulfite or sulfone groups

title-part.text: Nitrogen-free carboxylic acids or their salts

CPC-specific-text.text: Complex acids, e.g. phosphomolybdic, phosphotungstic, molybdotungstic
of elements different from the alkaline or alkaline-earth metals or with anions containing those elements
of alkaline or alkaline-earth metals with anions different from those provided for in D06P1/67341

using dyes dissolved in organic solvents or aqueous emulsions thereof
using dyes dissolved in solvents which are in the supercritical state

title-part.text: Textiles which contain different kinds of fibres

CPC-specific-text.text: mixtures of fibres containing amide groups
mixtures of fibres containing ester and amide groups
mixtures of fibres containing hydroxyl and amide groups
mixtures of fibres containing hydroxyl and ester groups

note.note-paragraph: In groups D06P5/04 - D06P5/10 a compound is always classified in the last appropriate place.

with combined acids or bases + oxidants + reductants means

title-part.text: Physical treatments affecting dyeing, e.g. ultrasonic or electric

Application of vibrations, pulses or waves for non-thermic purposes
Textile treatments at reduced pression, i.e. lower than 1 atm
Textile treatments at a pression higher than 1 atm

title-part.text: Effecting variation of dye affinity on textile material by chemical means that react with the fibre

reference.text: documents concerning material modified in the mass by compounding with modifying agents affecting the dye affinity after spinning, are not classified here: see the relevant groups C08, D01F, D06P3/00; grafting of monomers on textile materials C08F, D06M11/00
